meanings.definition: Enzymes that catalyze the hydrolysis of dipeptides into amino acids.
meanings.sent1: The dipeptidases in our body help to separate dipeptides into smaller parts.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study dipeptidases to understand how proteins are broken down into amino acids.
meanings.sent3: The dipeptidases at the enzyme party were busy splitting dipeptides like a team of tiny chefs.
meanings.sent4: Her precision in separating dipeptides was as sharp as the dipeptidases in a biological factory.
meanings.sent5: The classroom model vividly demonstrated how dipeptidases work on dipeptides.

meanings.definition: Proteins that break down dipeptides into individual amino acids.
meanings.sent1: Dipeptidases play a crucial role in breaking down dipeptides into amino acids for our body.
meanings.sent2: The food we eat is processed by dipeptidases to extract essential amino acids.
meanings.sent3: The dipeptidases in the digestive system were like little amino acid detectives.
meanings.sent4: The dipeptidases worked tirelessly, unraveling dipeptides like a protein puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The importance of dipeptidases in our diet was highlighted in the nutrition class.
